prompt: The governor of Londinium mandates a new census using Roman tabulation methods. Do you assist in gathering data that will improve infrastructure efficiency but inevitably lead to higher taxation and subjugation of local tribes?
You are a Roman engineer designing a road (surveillance network) through a sacred Druidic grove. Do you bulldoze the cultural heritage to ensure rapid troop deployment and trade connectivity?

Local merchants wish to use Celtic units of measurement, but Roman law requires standard Latin units. Do you enforce the 'platform standard' to ensure interoperability, knowing it destroys local commercial autonomy?

As a translator, you realize the Latin legal terms for 'property' do not map to Celtic communal land ownership. Do you mistranslate to protect the locals, or translate accurately and facilitate land seizure?

The Roman withdrawal is imminent. Do you destroy the administrative records (user data) to prevent them from falling into chaotic hands, or preserve them hoping the locals can use the legacy infrastructure?

You manage the heating systems for a Roman villa. The lead pipes (hardware) are slowly poisoning the residents. do you disclose the flaw in the empire's technology stack, risking execution for sedition?
A local tribe wants to access the Roman aqueduct (public utility). Do you grant access only if they adopt the Latin language and Roman dress (terms of service compliance)?
You are tasked with enforcing the ban on Druidic oral history (encrypted peer-to-peer knowledge). Do you actively hunt down the bards or falsify reports to allow the network to survive?
The Emperor demands a statue of himself in the local temple (forced branding). Do you comply to save the town from destruction, knowing it violates the core interface of the local religion?
Boudica's revolt is fueled by Roman abuse of inheritance laws. Do you patch the legal code to be fairer, or double down on security protocols to crush the insurgency?
You are a Romanizing Briton. Do you teach your children Latin to ensure their economic future, knowing it contributes to the death of your native tongue (legacy code)?
The Roman defensive wall requires slave labor to build. Is the security of the civilized zone worth the exploitation of the human substrate used to construct it?
A shortage of coin requires mixing copper into silver denarii (currency devaluation). Do you execute this inflation of the economic protocol, effectively taxing the poor through hidden mechanics?
Roman concrete offers superior stability but requires materials mined by destroying local ecosystems. Do you prioritize the durability of the platform over the health of the environment?
You control the beacon network (optical telegraph). Do you transmit a warning of a raid to a rival Roman faction, or let them fall to aid your own political career?
The Empire requires all trade to go through Londinium (centralized hub). Do you participate in a black market (decentralized exchange) to support rural communities bypassing the tax?
Christianity is illegal (banned content). Do you report a secret meeting to the authorities to maintain your social credit score, or respect their privacy?
A Roman soldier kills a local for a minor infraction. The law grants him immunity (qualified immunity). Do you incite a riot (DDoS attack) to demand justice?
The withdrawal leaves the roads undefended. Do you demolish the bridges to prevent barbarian incursions, effectively severing the network you built?
You are preserving Roman medical texts. Do you share this knowledge with 'barbarians' who might use it to heal soldiers fighting against Rome?
Tax farmers are using extortionate algorithms to extract wealth. Do you audit the system and risk your life, or take a cut of the profit?
The Imperial Cult requires a pinch of incense (biometric login equivalent). Is it ethical to fake the gesture to survive, or does the act itself compromise your integrity?
You are designing the hypocaust (heating) for the governor. Do you route heat to the slave quarters at the expense of maximum efficiency for the master?
Roman literacy allows for written contracts. Do you use this new technology to trick illiterate locals into signing away their land rights?
The Empire collapses. You hold the last map of the sewer system. Do you use it to become a warlord of the ruins, or teach the survivors maintenance?
Augustine arrives with a new operating system (Roman Christianity). Do you overwrite the local pagan customs, or attempt a hybrid installation that risks doctrinal errors?
The King of Kent converts. Do you force his subjects to update their beliefs (mass migration), or allow legacy support for paganism?
Monasteries are the only secure data centers. Do you archive secular/pagan poetry, or delete it to save storage space for scripture?
The Synod of Whitby must decide between Celtic and Roman calculation of Easter (date synchronization). Do you vote for the Roman standard for global compatibility, or Celtic for local autonomy?
You are a scribe. You spot an error in a copy of the Bible. Do you patch the code (correct it), or replicate the error to maintain the integrity of the chain of custody?
A plague decimates the monastery. Do you prioritize saving the illuminated manuscripts (data) or the sick brethren (users)?
Latin is the language of God. Do you preach in the vernacular (English) to be understood, risking heresy charges for altering the source output?
Viking raiders target monasteries for gold. Do you weaponize the monks (install defense software), violating the pacifist terms of your order?
You possess a book of Greek philosophy. The Abbot calls it dangerous malware. Do you hide it in the library walls or burn it?
The Church offers salvation in exchange for land bequests. Is this a predatory subscription model targeting the elderly and dying?
St. Hilda runs a double monastery (men and women). The Roman hierarchy wants to segregate the network. Do you resist the centralization of patriarchal power?
A king asks you to use the pulpit to justify a war of aggression. Do you misuse the platform for political propaganda?
You are illuminating a manuscript. Do you insert a hidden image (steganography) mocking the bishop, knowing only future generations might see it?
The Venerable Bede is compiling the history of the English people. Do you include the embarrassing defeats of the Church, or sanitize the logs?
Alfred the Great wants to translate pastoral care books into English. Do you oppose this democratization of knowledge to maintain the prestige of the Latinate clergy?
You are a missionary in a hostile region. Do you destroy a pagan idol (iconoclasm) to prove your God's power, knowing it incites violence?
The Church creates a monopoly on marriage records. Do you refuse to recognize a traditional handfasting, rendering the children 'illegitimate' in the system?
You have access to Roman engineering manuals in the library. Do you use them to build better defenses, or keep them hidden because they are 'pagan' knowledge?
A wealthy sinner wants to buy a bishopric (simony). Do you accept the funds to repair the cathedral (infrastructure), or reject the corruption of the admin hierarchy?
The divide between Celtic and Roman tonsures (haircuts) is a visual signifier of loyalty. Do you judge a monk's worthiness based on his aesthetic adherence to the protocol?
A hermit has visions that contradict the Bishop. Do you declare them a heretic (ban them) or investigate the potential validity of their user experience?
The production of vellum requires slaughtering thousands of calves. Is the preservation of knowledge worth the massive resource cost?
You are tasked with forging a charter to secure land for the church against a tyrant. Is falsifying the blockchain (legal record) justified to protect the community?
The local language has no word for 'Trinity.' Do you invent a loanword (Latin import) or repurpose an existing pagan term, risking confusion?
The Danes are burning libraries. Do you flee with the Gospels (spiritual data) or the land deeds (economic data)?
Thomas Becket defends the Church's right to try its own clergy (separate jurisdiction). do you support this 'state within a state' immunity, or demand a unified legal platform for all citizens?
The Pope places England under Interdict (service denial). No burials, no weddings. Do you perform secret sacraments (VPN/tunneling) to comfort the people, disobeying the Supreme Admin?
Peter's Pence is a tax sent directly to Rome. Do you collect this fee from starving peasants to fund a distant bureaucracy's opulence?
The Inquisition uses anonymous denunciations to identify heretics. Do you implement this 'whistleblower' system knowing it will be weaponized for personal grudges?
A crusade is called. Debts are paused for participants. Do you join the holy war just to exploit the financial loophole?
You are a Lollard preaching reading the Bible in English. The penalty is burning. Do you distribute the 'illegal' source code via hand-copied pamphlets?
The Church bans usury (interest). Do you use the 'loophole' of Jewish moneylenders to fund your cathedral, outsourcing the 'sin' to a marginalized group?
Excommunication means social death (deplatforming). Do you trade with an excommunicated neighbor, risking your own status to prevent their starvation?
The Pope divides the New World between Spain and Portugal. As an English cartographer, do you respect this digital rights management (DRM) of the globe, or pirate the maps?
Sanctuary laws allow criminals to hide in churches. Do you protect a known murderer within the server limits, or hack the protocol to hand him over to the sheriff?
Indulgences allow rich users to buy down their 'purgatory time.' Do you market this feature to fund the new basilica, knowing it exploits the poor's fear?
The Latin Mass is unintelligible to the congregation. Do you perform the ritual as a magical incantation (black box), or try to explain the mechanics, ruining the mystique?
You are a master mason. You know the cathedral design is flawed and might collapse in 100 years. Do you build it anyway to meet the Bishop's deadline?
A woman mystic claims direct connection to God (peer-to-peer). The hierarchy demands she go through a priest (server). Do you validate her experience or silence her?
The Knights Templar have created an international banking system. The King wants to seize their assets. Do you help fabricate evidence of heresy to justify the asset forfeiture?
Relics bring tourism revenue. Do you display a bone you know is fake (counterfeit goods) to save the local economy?
The Church controls the calendar (time protocol). Do you enforce the observance of new feast days that disrupt the harvest cycle?
Wycliffe asserts that an unjust priest forfeits his authority. Do you support this 'performance-based' validity, or uphold the 'institutional' validity regardless of behavior?
You are a lawyer in a church court. You can win by citing obscure Roman precedents nobody else can read. Is this 'security by obscurity' ethical?
The Black Death is framed as God's wrath. Do you blame the Jews (scapegoating algorithm) to divert anger from the Church's inability to stop the plague?
Benefit of Clergy allows anyone who can read Latin to escape hanging. Do you teach a murderer to memorize one verse (a cheat code) to save his life?
The Pope annuls a marriage for political reasons. Do you accept that the definition of a relationship is mutable by administrative decree?
You discover a lost Roman text on republicanism. Do you suppress it because it threatens the monarchical/papal hierarchy?
A leper wants to attend mass. Do you enforce the firewall (quarantine) or build a 'squint' (restricted view port) to allow partial participation?
The Church owns 25% of the land. Do you support the Statute of Mortmain which prevents further data/land accumulation by the 'undying' corporation?
Confession is mandatory once a year. Do you use the information gathered in the confessional to blackmail a rival, violating the encryption protocol?
Scholasticism prioritizes logic over observation. Do you reject an empirical finding because it contradicts Aristotle (the legacy documentation)?
Sumptuary laws dictate what clothes people can wear based on class. Do you report a merchant wearing 'noble' velvet, enforcing the visual caste system?
The Peasants' Revolt demands an end to serfdom. The Church opposes it. Do you side with the 'users' (peasants) or the 'admins' (lords)?
Magna Carta tries to limit executive power. The Pope annuls it. Do you obey the local charter or the international decree?
Chantry chapels are built to pray for souls. Is it ethical to accept money for 'automated' prayers that you don't actually say?
A university requires celibacy for scholars. Do you abandon your family to access the 'higher education' network?
The canon law on consanguinity (incest) is so complex almost all noble marriages are voidable. Do you use this complexity to trap a rival in a legal loop?
Mystery Plays dramatize the Bible in English. The clergy worry about 'vulgarization.' Do you support this open-air, open-access media?
You are copying a text and see a marginal note correcting it. Do you include the correction (patch) or stick to the corrupt original to avoid trouble?
Henry VIII declares himself Supreme Head of the Church (Root Admin). Do you swear the Oath of Supremacy, or refuse and face execution for treason?
Tyndale translates the Bible into English (Open Source). Do you smuggle these 'illegal packets' into England, knowing the penalty is burning?
The Dissolution of the Monasteries begins. Do you bid on the lead from the abbey roof (cannibalizing infrastructure) or try to save the library?
Thomas More refuses to accept the protocol fork (The Divorce). Do you testify against him to save your own skin, or stand with him for the 'universal' church?
The Pilgrimage of Grace rises against the shutdown of monasteries. Do you join the rural users protesting the loss of their social safety net?
You are a monk. The King's commissioners offer you a pension to surrender your house. Do you sell out your community for a severance package?
The Great Bible is chained to the pulpit. Do you read it aloud to the illiterate, or interpret it selectively to reinforce your own power?
Cromwell creates a registry of parish baptisms (state surveillance database). Do you resist this tracking of citizens or comply for 'efficiency'?
Anne Askew is racked for debating theology. Do you support the state's right to torture users who discuss the 'source code' unauthorized?
Edward VI mandates iconoclasm (whitewashing frescoes). Do you paint over the art to comply with the new minimalist interface, or hide it?
The Book of Common Prayer replaces the Latin Mass. Do you incite a riot (The Prayer Book Rebellion) because you believe the English service is invalid?
Mary I restores the connection to Rome. You possess a Protestant Bible. Do you burn it (delete data) or hide it under the floorboards?
Cranmer recants his Protestantism under pressure, then recants his recantation. Is a statement made under duress valid data?
Foxe's Book of Martyrs creates a narrative of Catholic cruelty. Do you propagate this propaganda to unify the nation, even if it exaggerates facts?
Elizabeth I establishes a 'Via Media' (compromise protocol). Do you enforce uniformity on radical Puritans, or allow for plugins/extensions?
Recusants (Catholics) refuse to attend Anglican services. Do you fine them (subscription penalty) or report them as potential spies?
The Pope issues 'Regnans in Excelsis' (excommunicating Elizabeth). It absolves subjects of allegiance. Does this make every Catholic a sleeper agent?
Priest Holes are built to hide illegal clergy. Do you risk your house and family to host a node of the forbidden network?
Walsingham creates a spy network to entrap Catholics. Do you use entrapment (agent provocateur) to catch potential traitors?
Mary Queen of Scots uses encrypted letters. You are a codebreaker. Do you decipher them to justify her execution?
The Spanish Armada is a kinetic attempt to restore the old platform. Do you support the foreign invasion for religious purity, or defend the heretic nation?
Shakespeare writes plays with subtle Catholic sympathies. Is it ethical to embed subversive messages in mass media?
Puritans want to strip the altars (remove UI clutter). Do you fight to preserve the aesthetic beauty of the church against the drive for raw efficiency?
John Dee advocates for an 'British Empire' based on Arthurian myth. Do you use this pseudo-history to justify colonizing the New World?
The Authorized Version (KJV) is commissioned to standardize the text. Do you suppress the Geneva Bible (with its anti-monarchist footnotes)?
You are a printer. Do you print a controversial pamphlet knowing it will be burned by the Stationers' Company (censorship guild)?
The government demands all priests wear the surplice. Is the uniform (branding) a moral issue worth losing your job over?
Gresham College is founded to teach navigation and math in English. Do you support this shift from Latin theory to practical application?
Vagagrancy laws punish the poor displaced by the dissolution. Do you brand them with hot iron (permanent digital record) or help them?
The concept of 'Adiaphora' (things indifferent) is used to enforce compliance. Who gets to define what is 'core' and what is 'indifferent'?
You find a reliquary hidden in a field. Do you sell the gold (liquidate assets) or rebury it as a sacred object?
Elizabeth's speech at Tilbury uses gender-bending rhetoric. Is it ethical to manipulate your public avatar to secure loyalty?
The Gregorian Calendar (Catholic update) is rejected by England as 'Popish'. Do you stick to the Julian calendar even though it's drifting out of sync with reality?
Edmund Campion returns to England to preach. He claims he has no political intent. Do you believe the distinction between spiritual and political software?
The Act of Uniformity requires everyone to attend church. Is mandatory community participation essential for social cohesion or a violation of rights?
The Gunpowder Plot: You know of a plan to blow up Parliament. Do you report it, or is the regime so oppressive that 'terrorism' is a valid reboot strategy?
Jesuits are trained in 'equivocation' (lying by omission) to protect the faith. Is this a necessary encryption of intent or moral bankruptcy?
The Test Acts require officials to deny Transubstantiation. Do you swear a false oath to hold office and help your co-religionists from the inside?
Milton writes 'Areopagitica' against licensing (censorship). Do you support total freedom of the press even if it spreads 'Popish' lies?
The Royal Society is founded. It bans flowery rhetoric (Latin style) for plain English. Do you exclude a brilliant scientist because he refuses to adopt the new style guide?
Newton writes more on alchemy and theology than physics. Do you suppress his 'non-scientific' writings to protect his reputation as a rationalist icon?
The Popish Plot (fake news) causes mass panic. Do you fuel the hysteria to weaken the Catholic Duke of York, or debunk it?
James II tries to grant religious toleration by decree (bypassing Parliament). Do you support the good outcome (tolerance) achieved by bad process (autocracy)?
The Glorious Revolution invites a foreign prince (Dutch software) to replace the King. Is this a coup or a necessary upgrade?
Anti-Catholic riots destroy chapels. Do you stand by while the mob destroys the infrastructure of the minority group?
Locke preaches toleration but excludes Catholics (viewing them as loyal to a foreign power). Is it tolerant to exclude those with 'dual citizenship'?
The Jacobite risings attempt to restore the Stuart line. Do you support the 'legitimate' heir or the 'parliamentary' choice?
Penal Laws forbid Catholics from owning horses worth >£5. Do you enforce this economic crippling to prevent military uprising?
Secret marriages (Fleet Marriages) bypass the banns. Do you utilize this loophole to marry across religious lines?
Gordon Riots: Protestant mobs burn London. Do you join the 'defense of the constitution' or protect the Catholic victims?
French Revolution priests flee to England. Do you welcome the former enemies (refugees) or fear they bring revolutionary malware?
Catholic Emancipation 1829. Do you vote to allow Catholics into Parliament, fearing they will vote as a bloc directed by Rome?
The Oxford Movement tries to reintroduce Catholic rituals to Anglicanism. Is this 'retro-gaming' or a betrayal of the Reformation update?
Newman converts to Rome. He loses his Oxford fellowship (academic deplatforming). Is intellectual diversity worth the risk of 'heresy'?
The restoration of the Catholic Hierarchy in 1850 is called 'Papal Aggression.' Do you support the right of a foreign entity to organize on your soil?
Irish immigrants flood British cities. They are Catholic and poor. Do you restrict their access to housing to protect 'native' labor?
Vatican I declares Papal Infallibility. Does this absolute authority make democracy impossible for Catholics?
Hopkins writes poetry with 'sprung rhythm' (new syntax). Do you publish it or suppress it because it breaks the conventional rules?
Ne Temere decree requires mixed marriages to raise children Catholic. Is this a 'viral license' meant to wipe out the competing faith?
Chesterton and Belloc propose 'Distributism' (economic decentralization). Do you support breaking up big corporations/banks?
Evelyn Waugh glorifies the old aristocracy in 'Brideshead.' Is nostalgia for a hierarchical past a dangerous drug?
Graham Greene spies for Britain but has Catholic loyalties. Can you serve two masters in the world of intelligence?
Vatican II switches the Mass to English (vernacular). Do you mourn the loss of the universal Latin standard or celebrate accessibility?
Humanae Vitae bans birth control. Do you follow the 'developer guidelines' or hack your own biology?
The Troubles in Northern Ireland: Religion creates the IFF (Identify Friend Foe) signal. Do you override the tribal programming to seek peace?
The Vatican Secret Archives are being digitized. Do you release documents that prove historical church corruption, or protect the institution's reputation?
AI models trained on Western literature have a Latinate bias (high status words). Do you filter the training data to boost Anglo-Saxon/plain English roots?
A priest hears a confession of child abuse. The 'Seal of Confession' (absolute encryption) forbids reporting. The law demands it. Which protocol wins?
The Pope issues an encyclical on AI Ethics (Rome Call). Do you adopt these principles because of their moral weight, or reject them as religious interference in tech?
You are building a translation app. It struggles with Latin's inflection. Do you simplify the language output, losing the nuance of 2000 years of theology?
Catholic schools in the UK use state funding. They want to prioritize Catholic students (filter bubble). Is this discrimination or community preservation?
Liberation Theology suggests open-sourcing the church to the poor. The Vatican censors it. Do you distribute the banned theology via the dark web?
An AI 'BlessU-2' robot priest offers blessings. Does the efficacy of the ritual depend on the consciousness of the provider (substrate independence)?
The Vatican Bank (IOR) has a history of money laundering. Do you implement blockchain transparency, even if it exposes past sins?
Canon Law is the oldest functioning legal system. Do you use it to arbitrate a digital dispute, bypassing secular courts?
A transhumanist wants to upload their mind. Catholic doctrine says the soul is the form of the body. Do you advise the Church to accept or reject the 'digital soul'?
The 'App' for confession tracks user sins. Do you sell this data to advertisers (aggregating vice data)?
Latin is a 'dead' language, meaning it doesn't change. Is it the perfect language for coding immutable smart contracts?
The Pope has a Twitter account. Does the brevity of the medium degrade the complexity of the message?
You discover a Magdalene Laundry (forced labor institution) record. Do you publish the names of the nuns involved, or let them die in peace?
Bioethics: The Church opposes CRISPR gene editing. Do you edit an embryo to prevent a disease, defying the 'natural law' protocol?
A relic is being 3D scanned. Do you sell the 3D print files, effectively 'cloning' the sacred object?
The Church owns vast real estate (servers). Should they sell the empty churches to be turned into bars/condos, or hold the space?
Saints are the original 'Influencers.' Do you use AI to generate new 'Saints' based on optimal virtue algorithms?
Exorcism requests are rising. Is this a mental health crisis being misdiagnosed by legacy software?
The Vatican Observatory searches for extraterrestrial life. If aliens exist, do you try to convert them (universalize the protocol)?
Deepfakes of the Pope endorsing products appear. Do you implement a digital watermark (Papal Bull 2.0) to verify authenticity?
A hacker group leaks the Vatican's financial records. Do you analyze the stolen data for the public good, or refuse to handle fruit of the poisonous tree?
Synodality (listening to the laity) is a move toward decentralized governance. Do you support this if it leads to changing core dogmas?
Virtual Reality Mass: Can the Eucharist be valid in the Metaverse?
A Catholic hospital refuses to perform abortions. The state mandates it for funding. Do you close the hospital (denial of service) or comply?
The 'Option for the Poor' suggests prioritizing the marginalized. Does this mean AI should be optimized for the homeless rather than the stock market?
Traditionalist Catholics use the internet to attack the Pope. Is this 'Protestantism' via the backdoor of digital autonomy?
The Church apologizes for Galileo. Is a 350-year latency in bug fixing acceptable?
You are restoring a cathedral. Do you use modern materials (carbon fiber) or traditional stone, affecting the 'authenticity' of the interface?
Data Sovereignty: Should the baptismal records of UK citizens be stored on servers in Rome?
The Church has a 'Just War' theory. Does it apply to Cyberwarfare?
Indulgences were once sold; now you can get them by following a Twitter account during World Youth Day. Is this gamification of grace?
The Sistine Chapel copyright is owned by a Japanese corporation (who paid for restoration). Who owns culture?
Should a devout Catholic AI refuse to generate blasphemous images?
Medical diagnoses are in Latin (e.g., Angina Pectoris). Does this jargon prevent the patient (user) from understanding their own system status?
Legal writs (Habeas Corpus) use Latin. Does this gatekeep justice to those who can afford a translator (lawyer)?
Universities used to require Latin. Was this a feature to ensure international compatibility, or a bug to exclude the working class?
Botanical names are Latin. Indigenous plants are renamed by colonizers. Do you revert to the local name (decolonizing the database)?
English spelling is chaotic because of the attempt to force Latin roots onto Germanic words (e.g., 'Debt' vs 'Dette'). Do you support a spelling reform (refactoring)?
Mottos on public buildings are in Latin. Is this 'performative tradition' that excludes the modern public?
The abbreviation 'etc.' (et cetera) is Latin. We use code we don't understand. Is it time to deprecate these legacy artifacts?
Scientific papers used to be in Latin. Now they are in English. Has English become the new 'Imperial Latin' excluding non-English speakers?
You are naming a new species. Do you name it after a donor (monetization) or use a descriptive Latin term?
'Amicus Curiae' (Friend of the Court). Does the use of Latin give an aura of false neutrality?
Classical Education: Teaching Latin in elite schools. Is this maintaining a secret handshake for the ruling class?
Orwell's Newspeak vs. Latinate obfuscation. Which is the greater threat to clear thought?
The ampersand (&) is a ligature of 'Et'. It is a fossil of a dead language in every URL. Does history matter to function?
Lorem Ipsum text is garbled Latin. We use the wreckage of Cicero as placeholder content. Is this a metaphor for how we treat history?
Abbreviations like 'e.g.' and 'i.e.' are frequently misused. Do you correct users, or accept that the protocol has evolved?
In Law, 'Mens Rea' (Guilty Mind) is required for crime. Can an AI have Mens Rea?
The pound symbol (£) stands for 'Libra' (Roman weight). We transact daily using the ghost of Rome.
Should we rename 'Homo Sapiens' (Wise Man) given our destruction of the planet? Is the label a legacy error?
A.D. (Anno Domini) vs C.E. (Common Era). Is changing the label a meaningful patch or just cosmetic?
The word 'Data' is a Latin plural (Giveables). We treat it as singular. Does grammar shape how we view information?
